tweets.text:
Our #StaffsSUNRISE project manager @TalesofaWildGuy chatted to @BBCRadioStoke's Stuart George today about how we've made the River Trent a more diverse wildlife habitat at the #VictoriaGround with @SoTCityCouncil & @EnvAgencyMids.
Listen at 2.39 here:  https://t.co/59UhzPDkyQ https://t.co/JZPiUE43qL

Protecting the environment is at the heart of what we do. 

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre adding an additional ¬£40m to our Green Recovery Challenge Fund! 

Find out more here: https://t.co/G06XlxXBiS https://t.co/PPA2o8tdv0

Looking to interview key stakeholders for a research project on wildfire management in the #PeakDistrict Feel free to retweet or get in touch @YorkshireWater @unitedutilities @SevernTrentLife @Natures_Voice @pennineprospect @EnvAgency

This was a really excellent panel - informative; articulate; purposeful; hopeful. Thanks so much to @harrietbulkeley @GeogDurham, @KathrynABrown @theCCCuk, Liz Parkes @EnvAgency & @Kat_Drayson @TfL  chaired superbly again for @RGS_IBG  by @MartineBBC. Thanks so much. https://t.co/IHzi03FVsv

It‚Äôs @london_climate Action Week and we're only 20 mins away from tonight's discussion where our panel of experts will debate what a world that‚Äôs 3¬∞C warmer could look like for the UK. Let's meet them! üëá

Starts 7pm
Non-members ¬£6; RGS-IBG members ¬£4 
https://t.co/PFanOIGOOG 1/6 https://t.co/nayjQTZYoO

Active monitoring today at #Black Potts ,taking time out to meet contractors and assess the programme of works .‚Å¶@MarkHill03‚Å© ‚Å¶@EnvAgencySE‚Å© ‚Å¶@wifo_ea‚Å© ‚Å¶@sarahchareEA‚Å© https://t.co/x6PnYM5ANw

We‚Äôre at Chiswell #Dorset today (we really are today!) testing the #flood sirens at 10am and 1pm. We do this every year to make sure they are working should they be needed. They will be loud! #PrepareActSurvive

UPDATE | #BradfordFire
 
We currently have six fire engines, two aerial ladder appliances & one foam appliance at the scene.
 
Work has continued throughout today with crews using water & foam to tackle the fire.

Thanks for the photos, @WestYorksPolice.

tweets.text: A 'hold your breath' moment - the windows have just been installed to the viewing gallery inside our Diglis fish pass! Can't wait to look through these üëÄüêüüêüüêü @severnrivers @CRTWalesandSW @EnvAgencyMids @kiergroup  #FishPass https://t.co/icvvBslB8w

The #Kendal Flood Risk Management Scheme will be delivered in three phases. 

Phase one will be constructed in Kendal with phases two & three being in Burneside, Staveley and Ings.
 
More details about the three phases can be found online at https://t.co/MGRW7UHwzo

Throughout the next few weeks, we will share key stats about the ¬£76mil Flood Risk Management Scheme in #Kendal which, when complete, will help better protect 1,480 homes & 1,151 business from #flooding.

Key information available on @thefloodhub & via https://t.co/F4fe5jNVEN https://t.co/ZcSyNT5Shq
Fatberg? Limescale? Something else? Tonight we're looking at what campaigners say is being discharged into a 'pristine' #Gloucestershire #river. @itvwestcountry https://t.co/N61ZCTowYz

@Young_Nudger @EnvAgencyYNE @nightgibson @DanJarvisMP @Steph_Peacock Fishlake has a washland directly next to the village which is roughly 11.5 times the surface area of Wombwell Ings.

Note - this is not the formal washland outline, this is just a polygon i've drawn to demonstrate the point that there is storage up and down the catchment. https://t.co/9SRe6AGyiH

Keeping all the @EnvAgencyNW assets in good condition is vital for the protection of the #Cumbria and #Lancashire communities and we use  ISO 55001 management system. Just done the introductory session for our independent auditors who are with us for the next few days https://t.co/DAv6N1YteP

Tomorrow we will be closing Wells Flood Gate ahead of high spring tides‚ö†Ô∏è

This means the road will be closed and there will be no access between Freeman Street and The Quay at the location of the defence from 6:30am to 10:30am.  #Norfolk #Flood https://t.co/rB7QopHOW4

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.
